heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and outside temperature (down 1.7°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 1.9°C) and feels like temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 233.7m higher than yesterday, 6.7m lower than the past week, 289.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 697m and a high of 1474m, averaging 1189.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Some rain can be expected, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
